0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• effectiveness on more than 1 course (2 sessions scheduled 1 week apart) not established.
  • Actinic keratosis: apply up to 1 gram (half tube) of cream TOPICALLY on lesion(s) during photodynamic therapy session (2 sessions 1 week apart), followed by occlusive dressing for 3 hr (at least 2.5 hr and no more than 4 hr in duration), and then red light illumination for 7 to 10 min; MAX, 1 gram (half tube) per treatment session

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono: safety and efficacy not established in pediatric patients under 18 years of age

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono:
• allergies to porphyrins
  • cutaneous photosensitivity, preexisting
  • hypersensitivity to methyl aminolevulinate or any component of the product, including peanut and almond oil

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• contact sensitization has been reported; avoid contact with skin, mucous membranes, and eyes; wear nitrile gloves during application and removal of drug
  • exposure to sunlight or bright indoor light; avoid on treated lesions and surrounding skin for at least 48 hours post-photodynamic therapy (PDT); cover and protect area from light
  • prolonged exposure to drug, greater than 4 hours; should be avoided
  • redness, swelling, burning, and stinging, persisting for greater than 3 weeks posttherapy; instruct patient to contact doctor
  • treatment site photosensitivity may occur during time period between drug application and PDT; avoid exposure to sunlight, bright indoor light, and extreme cold

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
Dermatologic:Application site edema (18%), Application site erythema (63%), Application site pain, Application site pain (Severe), Application site reaction (Severe) (22%), Blister, Burning sensation, Burning sensation (Severe), Peeling of skin (14%), Pruritus (22%), Scab of skin
Serious
  • Dermatologic:Allergic contact dermatitis, Eczema, Pustule, Urticaria
  • Ophthalmic:Keratitis, Macular retinal edema, Vitreous detachment
  • Other:Angioedema

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Following topical application of methyl aminolevulinate (prodrug), it converts to photoactive porphyrins (PAPs). The accumulated PAPs in target lesions undergo light activation, resulting in a cytotoxic process in the presence of oxygen. This leads to formation of singlet oxygen and cell-damaging phototoxicity to light-exposed lesions.

sub.title: Absorption
sub.mono: bioavailability: 0.26% of applied dose after 24 hours

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
General Information
  • product is intended to be used by physicians in the physician's office only
  • remove scales and crusts, and roughen lesion surfaces, then apply cream topically on lesion(s) and occlusive dressing for 3 hr (at least 2.5 hr and no more than 4 hr in duration), followed subsequently by red light illumination for 7 to 10 min
  • rinse the cream off if the patient cannot have the red light illumination 3 hours after application; have patient protect exposed area from sunlight, prolonged or intense light for at least 48 hours
  • use nitrile gloves and Universal Precautions; vinyl and latex gloves do not provide adequate protection

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono:
• lesion response and cosmetic outcome at 3 months post-photodynamic therapy (PDT)
  • signs and symptoms of local skin reactions including severe burning, crusting, pustules, edema, erythema, and pain
